void AddMappingChangeTracking ( GamepadMapping_t * mapping)
static
511{
512 MappingChangeTracker *tracker;

514 GamepadMapping_t **new_mappings;

516 SDL_AssertJoysticksLocked();
517
518 SDL_assert(s_mappingChangeTracker != NULL);
519 tracker = s_mappingChangeTracker;
520 num_mappings = tracker->num_changed_mappings;

void HandleJoystickAxis ( Uint64 timestamp,
SDL_Gamepad * gamepad,
int axis,
int value )
static
182{
183 int i;
184 SDL_GamepadBinding *last_match;
185 SDL_GamepadBinding *match = NULL;
186
187 SDL_AssertJoysticksLocked();
188
189 last_match = gamepad->last_match_axis[axis];
190 for (i = 0; i < gamepad->num_bindings; ++i) {
191 SDL_GamepadBinding *binding = &gamepad->bindings[i];
192 if (binding->input_type == SDL_GAMEPAD_BINDTYPE_AXIS &&
193 axis == binding->input.axis.axis) {
194 if (binding->input.axis.axis_min < binding->input.axis.axis_max) {
195 if (value >= binding->input.axis.axis_min &&
196 value <= binding->input.axis.axis_max) {
197 match = binding;
198 break;
199 }
200 } else {
201 if (value >= binding->input.axis.axis_max &&
202 value <= binding->input.axis.axis_min) {
203 match = binding;
204 break;
205 }
206 }
207 }
208 }
209
210 if (last_match && (!match || !HasSameOutput(last_match, match))) {
211 // Clear the last input that this axis generated
212 ResetOutput(timestamp, gamepad, last_match);
213 }
214
215 if (match) {
216 if (match->output_type == SDL_GAMEPAD_BINDTYPE_AXIS) {
217 if (match->input.axis.axis_min != match->output.axis.axis_min || match->input.axis.axis_max != match->output.axis.axis_max) {
218 float normalized_value = (float)(value - match->input.axis.axis_min) / (match->input.axis.axis_max - match->input.axis.axis_min);
219 value = match->output.axis.axis_min + (int)(normalized_value * (match->output.axis.axis_max - match->output.axis.axis_min));
220 }
221 SDL_SendGamepadAxis(timestamp, gamepad, match->output.axis.axis, (Sint16)value);
222 } else {
223 bool down;
224 int threshold = match->input.axis.axis_min + (match->input.axis.axis_max - match->input.axis.axis_min) / 2;
225 if (match->input.axis.axis_max < match->input.axis.axis_min) {
226 down = (value <= threshold);
227 } else {
228 down = (value >= threshold);
229 }
230 SDL_SendGamepadButton(timestamp, gamepad, match->output.button, down);
231 }
232 }
233 gamepad->last_match_axis[axis] = match;
234}

void PopMappingChangeTracking ( void )
static
544{
545 int i;
546 MappingChangeTracker *tracker;
547
548 SDL_AssertJoysticksLocked();
549
550 SDL_assert(s_mappingChangeTracker != NULL);
551 tracker = s_mappingChangeTracker;
552 --tracker->refcount;
553 if (tracker->refcount > 0) {
554 return;
555 }
556 s_mappingChangeTracker = NULL;
557
558 // Now check to see what gamepads changed because of the mapping changes
559 if (tracker->joysticks && tracker->joystick_mappings) {
560 for (i = 0; tracker->joysticks[i]; ++i) {
561 // Looking up the new mapping might create one and associate it with the gamepad (and generate events)
562 SDL_JoystickID joystick = tracker->joysticks[i];
563 SDL_Gamepad *gamepad = SDL_GetGamepadFromID(joystick);
564 GamepadMapping_t *new_mapping = SDL_PrivateGetGamepadMapping(joystick, false);
565 GamepadMapping_t *old_mapping = gamepad ? gamepad->mapping : tracker->joystick_mappings[i];
566
567 if (new_mapping && !old_mapping) {
568 SDL_InsertIntoHashTable(s_gamepadInstanceIDs, (void *)(uintptr_t)joystick, (const void *)true, true);
569 SDL_PrivateGamepadAdded(joystick);
570 } else if (old_mapping && !new_mapping) {
571 SDL_InsertIntoHashTable(s_gamepadInstanceIDs, (void *)(uintptr_t)joystick, (const void *)false, true);
572 SDL_PrivateGamepadRemoved(joystick);
573 } else if (old_mapping != new_mapping || HasMappingChangeTracking(tracker, new_mapping)) {
574 if (gamepad) {
575 SDL_PrivateLoadButtonMapping(gamepad, new_mapping);
576 }
577 SDL_PrivateGamepadRemapped(joystick);
578 }
579 }
580 }
581
582 SDL_free(tracker->joysticks);
583 SDL_free(tracker->joystick_mappings);
584 SDL_free(tracker->changed_mappings);
585 SDL_free(tracker);
586}

◆ SDL_AddGamepadMapping()

int SDL_AddGamepadMapping ( const char * mapping)

Add support for gamepads that SDL is unaware of or change the binding of an existing gamepad.

The mapping string has the format "GUID,name,mapping", where GUID is the string value from SDL_GUIDToString(), name is the human readable string for the device and mappings are gamepad mappings to joystick ones. Under Windows there is a reserved GUID of "xinput" that covers all XInput devices. The mapping format for joystick is:

  • bX: a joystick button, index X
  • hX.Y: hat X with value Y
  • aX: axis X of the joystick

Buttons can be used as a gamepad axes and vice versa.

If a device with this GUID is already plugged in, SDL will generate an SDL_EVENT_GAMEPAD_ADDED event.

This string shows an example of a valid mapping for a gamepad:

"341a3608000000000000504944564944,Afterglow PS3 Controller,a:b1,b:b2,y:b3,x:b0,start:b9,guide:b12,back:b8,dpup:h0.1,dpleft:h0.8,dpdown:h0.4,dpright:h0.2,leftshoulder:b4,rightshoulder:b5,leftstick:b10,rightstick:b11,leftx:a0,lefty:a1,rightx:a2,righty:a3,lefttrigger:b6,righttrigger:b7"
Parameters
mappingthe mapping string.
Returns
1 if a new mapping is added, 0 if an existing mapping is updated, -1 on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
It is safe to call this function from any thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also

◆ SDL_AddGamepadMappingsFromFile()

int SDL_AddGamepadMappingsFromFile ( const char * file)

Load a set of gamepad mappings from a file.

You can call this function several times, if needed, to load different database files.

If a new mapping is loaded for an already known gamepad GUID, the later version will overwrite the one currently loaded.

Any new mappings for already plugged in controllers will generate SDL_EVENT_GAMEPAD_ADDED events.

Mappings not belonging to the current platform or with no platform field specified will be ignored (i.e. mappings for Linux will be ignored in Windows, etc).

Parameters
filethe mappings file to load.
Returns
the number of mappings added or -1 on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
It is safe to call this function from any thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also

◆ SDL_AddGamepadMappingsFromIO()

int SDL_AddGamepadMappingsFromIO ( SDL_IOStream * src,
bool closeio )

Load a set of gamepad mappings from an SDL_IOStream.

You can call this function several times, if needed, to load different database files.

If a new mapping is loaded for an already known gamepad GUID, the later version will overwrite the one currently loaded.

Any new mappings for already plugged in controllers will generate SDL_EVENT_GAMEPAD_ADDED events.

Mappings not belonging to the current platform or with no platform field specified will be ignored (i.e. mappings for Linux will be ignored in Windows, etc).

This function will load the text database entirely in memory before processing it, so take this into consideration if you are in a memory constrained environment.

Parameters
srcthe data stream for the mappings to be added.
closeioif true, calls SDL_CloseIO() on src before returning, even in the case of an error.
Returns
the number of mappings added or -1 on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Thread Safety
It is safe to call this function from any thread.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also

901 } else if (vendor == USB_VENDOR_8BITDO && product == USB_PRODUCT_8BITDO_ULTIMATE2_WIRELESS) {
902 SDL_strlcat(mapping_string, "paddle1:b12,paddle2:b11,paddle3:b14,paddle4:b13,", sizeof(mapping_string));
903 } else {
904 switch (SDL_GetGamepadTypeFromGUID(guid, NULL)) {
905 case SDL_GAMEPAD_TYPE_PS4:
906 // PS4 controllers have an additional touchpad button
907 SDL_strlcat(mapping_string, "touchpad:b11,", sizeof(mapping_string));
908 break;
909 case SDL_GAMEPAD_TYPE_PS5:
910 // PS5 controllers have a microphone button and an additional touchpad button
911 SDL_strlcat(mapping_string, "touchpad:b11,misc1:b12,", sizeof(mapping_string));
912 // DualSense Edge controllers have paddles
913 if (SDL_IsJoystickDualSenseEdge(vendor, product)) {
914 SDL_strlcat(mapping_string, "paddle1:b16,paddle2:b15,paddle3:b14,paddle4:b13,", sizeof(mapping_string));
915 }
916 break;
917 case SDL_GAMEPAD_TYPE_XBOXONE:
918 if (SDL_IsJoystickXboxOneElite(vendor, product)) {
919 // XBox One Elite Controllers have 4 back paddle buttons
920 SDL_strlcat(mapping_string, "paddle1:b11,paddle2:b13,paddle3:b12,paddle4:b14,", sizeof(mapping_string));
921 } else if (SDL_IsJoystickXboxSeriesX(vendor, product)) {
922 // XBox Series X Controllers have a share button under the guide button
923 SDL_strlcat(mapping_string, "misc1:b11,", sizeof(mapping_string));
924 }
925 break;
926 default:
927 if (vendor == 0 && product == 0) {
928 // This is a Bluetooth Nintendo Switch Pro controller
929 SDL_strlcat(mapping_string, "misc1:b11,", sizeof(mapping_string));
930 }
931 break;
932 }
933 }
934 }
935
936 return SDL_PrivateAddMappingForGUID(guid, mapping_string, &existing, SDL_GAMEPAD_MAPPING_PRIORITY_DEFAULT);
937}

◆ SDL_GamepadEventWatcher()

bool SDLCALL SDL_GamepadEventWatcher ( void * userdata,
SDL_Event * event )
static
367{
368 SDL_Gamepad *gamepad;
369
370 switch (event->type) {
371 case SDL_EVENT_JOYSTICK_AXIS_MOTION:
372 {
373 SDL_AssertJoysticksLocked();
374
375 for (gamepad = SDL_gamepads; gamepad; gamepad = gamepad->next) {
376 if (gamepad->joystick->instance_id == event->jaxis.which) {
377 HandleJoystickAxis(event->common.timestamp, gamepad, event->jaxis.axis, event->jaxis.value);
378 break;
379 }
380 }
381 } break;
382 case SDL_EVENT_JOYSTICK_BUTTON_DOWN:
383 case SDL_EVENT_JOYSTICK_BUTTON_UP:
384 {
385 SDL_AssertJoysticksLocked();
386
387 for (gamepad = SDL_gamepads; gamepad; gamepad = gamepad->next) {
388 if (gamepad->joystick->instance_id == event->jbutton.which) {
389 HandleJoystickButton(event->common.timestamp, gamepad, event->jbutton.button, event->jbutton.down);
390 break;
391 }
392 }
393 } break;
394 case SDL_EVENT_JOYSTICK_HAT_MOTION:
395 {
396 SDL_AssertJoysticksLocked();
397
398 for (gamepad = SDL_gamepads; gamepad; gamepad = gamepad->next) {
399 if (gamepad->joystick->instance_id == event->jhat.which) {
400 HandleJoystickHat(event->common.timestamp, gamepad, event->jhat.hat, event->jhat.value);
401 break;
402 }
403 }
404 } break;
405 case SDL_EVENT_JOYSTICK_UPDATE_COMPLETE:
406 {
407 SDL_AssertJoysticksLocked();
408
409 if (SDL_EventEnabled(SDL_EVENT_GAMEPAD_UPDATE_COMPLETE)) {
410 for (gamepad = SDL_gamepads; gamepad; gamepad = gamepad->next) {
411 if (gamepad->joystick->instance_id == event->jdevice.which) {
412 SDL_Event deviceevent;
413
414 deviceevent.type = SDL_EVENT_GAMEPAD_UPDATE_COMPLETE;
415 deviceevent.common.timestamp = event->jdevice.timestamp;
416 deviceevent.gdevice.which = event->jdevice.which;
417 SDL_PushEvent(&deviceevent);
418 break;
419 }
420 }
421 }
422 } break;
423 default:
424 break;
425 }
426
427 return true;
428}

◆ SDL_GetGamepadAxis()

Sint16 SDL_GetGamepadAxis ( SDL_Gamepad * gamepad,
SDL_GamepadAxis axis )

Get the current state of an axis control on a gamepad.

The axis indices start at index 0.

For thumbsticks, the state is a value ranging from -32768 (up/left) to 32767 (down/right).

Triggers range from 0 when released to 32767 when fully pressed, and never return a negative value. Note that this differs from the value reported by the lower-level SDL_GetJoystickAxis(), which normally uses the full range.

Note that for invalid gamepads or axes, this will return 0. Zero is also a valid value in normal operation; usually it means a centered axis.

Parameters
gamepada gamepad.
axisan axis index (one of the SDL_GamepadAxis values).
Returns
axis state.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also
SDL_GamepadHasAxis
SDL_GetGamepadButton
3020{
3021 Sint16 result = 0;
3022
3023 SDL_LockJoysticks();
3024 {
3025 int i;
3026
3027 CHECK_GAMEPAD_MAGIC(gamepad, 0);
3028
3029 for (i = 0; i < gamepad->num_bindings; ++i) {
3030 const SDL_GamepadBinding *binding = &gamepad->bindings[i];
3031 if (binding->output_type == SDL_GAMEPAD_BINDTYPE_AXIS && binding->output.axis.axis == axis) {
3032 int value = 0;
3033 bool valid_input_range;
3034 bool valid_output_range;
3035
3036 if (binding->input_type == SDL_GAMEPAD_BINDTYPE_AXIS) {
3037 value = SDL_GetJoystickAxis(gamepad->joystick, binding->input.axis.axis);
3038 if (binding->input.axis.axis_min < binding->input.axis.axis_max) {
3039 valid_input_range = (value >= binding->input.axis.axis_min && value <= binding->input.axis.axis_max);
3040 } else {
3041 valid_input_range = (value >= binding->input.axis.axis_max && value <= binding->input.axis.axis_min);
3042 }
3043 if (valid_input_range) {
3044 if (binding->input.axis.axis_min != binding->output.axis.axis_min || binding->input.axis.axis_max != binding->output.axis.axis_max) {
3045 float normalized_value = (float)(value - binding->input.axis.axis_min) / (binding->input.axis.axis_max - binding->input.axis.axis_min);
3046 value = binding->output.axis.axis_min + (int)(normalized_value * (binding->output.axis.axis_max - binding->output.axis.axis_min));
3047 }
3048 } else {
3049 value = 0;
3050 }
3051 } else if (binding->input_type == SDL_GAMEPAD_BINDTYPE_BUTTON) {
3052 if (SDL_GetJoystickButton(gamepad->joystick, binding->input.button)) {
3053 value = binding->output.axis.axis_max;
3054 }
3055 } else if (binding->input_type == SDL_GAMEPAD_BINDTYPE_HAT) {
3056 int hat_mask = SDL_GetJoystickHat(gamepad->joystick, binding->input.hat.hat);
3057 if (hat_mask & binding->input.hat.hat_mask) {
3058 value = binding->output.axis.axis_max;
3059 }
3060 }
3061
3062 if (binding->output.axis.axis_min < binding->output.axis.axis_max) {
3063 valid_output_range = (value >= binding->output.axis.axis_min && value <= binding->output.axis.axis_max);
3064 } else {
3065 valid_output_range = (value >= binding->output.axis.axis_max && value <= binding->output.axis.axis_min);
3066 }
3067 // If the value is zero, there might be another binding that makes it non-zero
3068 if (value != 0 && valid_output_range) {
3069 result = (Sint16)value;
3070 break;
3071 }
3072 }
3073 }
3074 }
3075 SDL_UnlockJoysticks();
3076
3077 return result;

◆ SDL_GetGamepadAxisFromString()

SDL_GamepadAxis SDL_GetGamepadAxisFromString ( const char * str)

Convert a string into SDL_GamepadAxis enum.

This function is called internally to translate SDL_Gamepad mapping strings for the underlying joystick device into the consistent SDL_Gamepad mapping. You do not normally need to call this function unless you are parsing SDL_Gamepad mappings in your own code.

Note specially that "righttrigger" and "lefttrigger" map to SDL_GAMEPAD_AXIS_RIGHT_TRIGGER and SDL_GAMEPAD_AXIS_LEFT_TRIGGER, respectively.

the SDL_GamepadAxis enum corresponding to the input string, or SDL_GAMEPAD_AXIS_INVALID if no match was found.

◆ SDL_GetGamepadJoystick()

SDL_Joystick * SDL_GetGamepadJoystick ( SDL_Gamepad * gamepad)

Get the underlying joystick from a gamepad.

This function will give you a SDL_Joystick object, which allows you to use the SDL_Joystick functions with a SDL_Gamepad object. This would be useful for getting a joystick's position at any given time, even if it hasn't moved (moving it would produce an event, which would have the axis' value).

The pointer returned is owned by the SDL_Gamepad. You should not call SDL_CloseJoystick() on it, for example, since doing so will likely cause SDL to crash.

Parameters
gamepadthe gamepad object that you want to get a joystick from.
Returns
an SDL_Joystick object, or NULL on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
3744{
3745 SDL_Joystick *joystick;
3746

3748 {
3749 CHECK_GAMEPAD_MAGIC(gamepad, NULL);
3750
3751 joystick = gamepad->joystick;
3752 }
3753 SDL_UnlockJoysticks();
3754
3755 return joystick;
3756}

◆ SDL_GetGamepadMappings()

char ** SDL_GetGamepadMappings ( int * count)

Get the current gamepad mappings.

Parameters
counta pointer filled in with the number of mappings returned, can be NULL.
Returns
an array of the mapping strings, NULL-terminated, or NULL on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information. This is a single allocation that should be freed with SDL_free() when it is no longer needed.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
2379{

2382 char **mappings = NULL;
2383

2385 *count = 0;

2393 }
2394 num_mappings++;
2395 }
2396

2398 bool failed = false;

2400 if (!mappings) {
2401 failed = true;
2402 } else {
2403 int i = 0;
2404 for (GamepadMapping_t *mapping = s_pSupportedGamepads; mapping; mapping = mapping->next) {
2405 if (SDL_memcmp(&mapping->guid, &s_zeroGUID, sizeof(mapping->guid)) == 0) {
2406 continue;

2412 break; // error string is already set.

2417

2421

2424 if (!failed) {
2425 result = (char **) SDL_malloc(final_allocation);
2426 if (result) {
2427 final_allocation -= (sizeof (char *) * num_mappings + 1);
2428 char *strptr = (char *) (result + (num_mappings + 1));
2429 for (int i = 0; i < num_mappings; i++) {
2430 result[i] = strptr;
2431 const size_t slen = SDL_strlcpy(strptr, mappings[i], final_allocation) + 1;
2432 SDL_assert(final_allocation >= slen);
2433 final_allocation -= slen;
2434 strptr += slen;
2435 }
2436 result[num_mappings] = NULL;
2437

2439 *count = num_mappings;
2440 }
2441 }
2442 }
2443

◆ SDL_GetGamepadPowerInfo()

SDL_PowerState SDL_GetGamepadPowerInfo ( SDL_Gamepad * gamepad,
int * percent )

Get the battery state of a gamepad.

You should never take a battery status as absolute truth. Batteries (especially failing batteries) are delicate hardware, and the values reported here are best estimates based on what that hardware reports. It's not uncommon for older batteries to lose stored power much faster than it reports, or completely drain when reporting it has 20 percent left, etc.

Parameters
gamepadthe gamepad object to query.
percenta pointer filled in with the percentage of battery life left, between 0 and 100, or NULL to ignore. This will be filled in with -1 we can't determine a value or there is no battery.
Returns
the current battery state.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
3714{
3715 SDL_Joystick *joystick = SDL_GetGamepadJoystick(gamepad);
3716
3717 if (percent) {
3718 *percent = -1;
3719 }
3720 if (!joystick) {
3721 return SDL_POWERSTATE_ERROR;
3722 }
3723 return SDL_GetJoystickPowerInfo(joystick, percent);
3724}

◆ SDL_GetGamepadProperties()

SDL_PropertiesID SDL_GetGamepadProperties ( SDL_Gamepad * gamepad)

Get the properties associated with an opened gamepad.

These properties are shared with the underlying joystick object.

The following read-only properties are provided by SDL:

  • SDL_PROP_GAMEPAD_CAP_MONO_LED_BOOLEAN: true if this gamepad has an LED that has adjustable brightness
  • SDL_PROP_GAMEPAD_CAP_RGB_LED_BOOLEAN: true if this gamepad has an LED that has adjustable color
  • SDL_PROP_GAMEPAD_CAP_PLAYER_LED_BOOLEAN: true if this gamepad has a player LED
  • SDL_PROP_GAMEPAD_CAP_RUMBLE_BOOLEAN: true if this gamepad has left/right rumble
  • SDL_PROP_GAMEPAD_CAP_TRIGGER_RUMBLE_BOOLEAN: true if this gamepad has simple trigger rumble
Parameters
gamepada gamepad identifier previously returned by SDL_OpenGamepad().
Returns
a valid property ID on success or 0 on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.

2191 }

2202
2203 tmp += SDL_GAMEPAD_HINT_FIELD_SIZE;
2204

2206 negate = true;
2207 ++tmp;
2208 } else {
2209 negate = false;
2210 }
2211
2212 len = 0;
2213 while (*tmp && *tmp != ',' && *tmp != ':' && len < (sizeof(hint) - 1)) {
2214 hint[len++] = *tmp++;
2215 }
2216 hint[len] = '\0';
2217
2218 if (tmp[0] == ':' && tmp[1] == '=') {
2219 tmp += 2;
2220 default_value = SDL_atoi(tmp);
2221 } else {
2222 default_value = false;
2223 }
2224

2226 // This hint is used to signal whether the mapping uses positional buttons or not
2227 if (negate) {
2228 // This mapping uses positional buttons, we can use it as-is
2229 } else {
2230 // This mapping uses labeled buttons, we need to swap them to positional
2231 remapped = SDL_ConvertMappingToPositionalAXBY(mappingString);
2232 if (!remapped) {
2233 goto done;
2234 }
2235 mappingString = remapped;
2236 }
2237 } else if (SDL_strcmp(hint, "SDL_GAMECONTROLLER_USE_BUTTON_LABELS") == 0) {

2253 value = !value;
2254 }
2255 if (!value) {

2258 }

1291 axis = SDL_GetGamepadAxisFromString(szGameButton);
1292 button = SDL_PrivateGetGamepadButtonFromString(szGameButton, axby_mapping, baxy_mapping);
1293 if (axis != SDL_GAMEPAD_AXIS_INVALID) {
1294 bind.output_type = SDL_GAMEPAD_BINDTYPE_AXIS;
1295 bind.output.axis.axis = axis;
1296 if (axis == SDL_GAMEPAD_AXIS_LEFT_TRIGGER || axis == SDL_GAMEPAD_AXIS_RIGHT_TRIGGER) {
1297 bind.output.axis.axis_min = 0;
1298 bind.output.axis.axis_max = SDL_JOYSTICK_AXIS_MAX;
1299 } else {
1300 if (half_axis_output == '+') {
1301 bind.output.axis.axis_min = 0;
1302 bind.output.axis.axis_max = SDL_JOYSTICK_AXIS_MAX;
1303 } else if (half_axis_output == '-') {
1304 bind.output.axis.axis_min = 0;
1305 bind.output.axis.axis_max = SDL_JOYSTICK_AXIS_MIN;
1306 } else {
1307 bind.output.axis.axis_min = SDL_JOYSTICK_AXIS_MIN;
1308 bind.output.axis.axis_max = SDL_JOYSTICK_AXIS_MAX;
1309 }
1310 }
1311 } else if (button != SDL_GAMEPAD_BUTTON_INVALID) {
1312 bind.output_type = SDL_GAMEPAD_BINDTYPE_BUTTON;
1313 bind.output.button = button;
1314 } else {
1315 return false;
1316 }
1317
1318 if (*szJoystickButton == '+' || *szJoystickButton == '-') {
1319 half_axis_input = *szJoystickButton++;
1320 }
1321 if (szJoystickButton[SDL_strlen(szJoystickButton) - 1] == '~') {
1322 invert_input = true;
1323 }
1324
1325 if (szJoystickButton[0] == 'a' && SDL_isdigit((unsigned char)szJoystickButton[1])) {
1326 bind.input_type = SDL_GAMEPAD_BINDTYPE_AXIS;
1327 bind.input.axis.axis = SDL_atoi(&szJoystickButton[1]);
1328 if (half_axis_input == '+') {
1329 bind.input.axis.axis_min = 0;
1330 bind.input.axis.axis_max = SDL_JOYSTICK_AXIS_MAX;
1331 } else if (half_axis_input == '-') {
1332 bind.input.axis.axis_min = 0;
1333 bind.input.axis.axis_max = SDL_JOYSTICK_AXIS_MIN;
1334 } else {
1335 bind.input.axis.axis_min = SDL_JOYSTICK_AXIS_MIN;
1336 bind.input.axis.axis_max = SDL_JOYSTICK_AXIS_MAX;
1337 }
1338 if (invert_input) {
1339 int tmp = bind.input.axis.axis_min;
1340 bind.input.axis.axis_min = bind.input.axis.axis_max;
1341 bind.input.axis.axis_max = tmp;
1342 }
1343 } else if (szJoystickButton[0] == 'b' && SDL_isdigit((unsigned char)szJoystickButton[1])) {
1344 bind.input_type = SDL_GAMEPAD_BINDTYPE_BUTTON;
1345 bind.input.button = SDL_atoi(&szJoystickButton[1]);
1346 } else if (szJoystickButton[0] == 'h' && SDL_isdigit((unsigned char)szJoystickButton[1]) &&
1347 szJoystickButton[2] == '.' && SDL_isdigit((unsigned char)szJoystickButton[3])) {
1348 int hat = SDL_atoi(&szJoystickButton[1]);
1349 int mask = SDL_atoi(&szJoystickButton[3]);
1350 bind.input_type = SDL_GAMEPAD_BINDTYPE_HAT;
1351 bind.input.hat.hat = hat;
1352 bind.input.hat.hat_mask = mask;
1353 } else {
1354 return false;
1355 }
1356
1357 for (i = 0; i < gamepad->num_bindings; ++i) {
1358 if (SDL_memcmp(&gamepad->bindings[i], &bind, sizeof(bind)) == 0) {
1359 // We already have this binding, could be different face button names?
1360 return true;
1361 }
1362 }
1363
1364 ++gamepad->num_bindings;
1365 new_bindings = (SDL_GamepadBinding *)SDL_realloc(gamepad->bindings, gamepad->num_bindings * sizeof(*gamepad->bindings));
1366 if (!new_bindings) {
1367 SDL_free(gamepad->bindings);
1368 gamepad->num_bindings = 0;
1369 gamepad->bindings = NULL;
1370 return false;
1371 }
1372 gamepad->bindings = new_bindings;
1373 gamepad->bindings[gamepad->num_bindings - 1] = bind;
1374 return true;
1375}

◆ SDL_RumbleGamepad()

bool SDL_RumbleGamepad ( SDL_Gamepad * gamepad,
Uint16 low_frequency_rumble,
Uint16 high_frequency_rumble,
Uint32 duration_ms )

Start a rumble effect on a gamepad.

Each call to this function cancels any previous rumble effect, and calling it with 0 intensity stops any rumbling.

This function requires you to process SDL events or call SDL_UpdateJoysticks() to update rumble state.

Parameters
gamepadthe gamepad to vibrate.
low_frequency_rumblethe intensity of the low frequency (left) rumble motor, from 0 to 0xFFFF.
high_frequency_rumblethe intensity of the high frequency (right) rumble motor, from 0 to 0xFFFF.
duration_msthe duration of the rumble effect, in milliseconds.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.

◆ SDL_RumbleGamepadTriggers()

bool SDL_RumbleGamepadTriggers ( SDL_Gamepad * gamepad,
Uint16 left_rumble,
Uint16 right_rumble,
Uint32 duration_ms )

Start a rumble effect in the gamepad's triggers.

Each call to this function cancels any previous trigger rumble effect, and calling it with 0 intensity stops any rumbling.

Note that this is rumbling of the triggers and not the gamepad as a whole. This is currently only supported on Xbox One gamepads. If you want the (more common) whole-gamepad rumble, use SDL_RumbleGamepad() instead.

This function requires you to process SDL events or call SDL_UpdateJoysticks() to update rumble state.

Parameters
gamepadthe gamepad to vibrate.
left_rumblethe intensity of the left trigger rumble motor, from 0 to 0xFFFF.
right_rumblethe intensity of the right trigger rumble motor, from 0 to 0xFFFF.
duration_msthe duration of the rumble effect, in milliseconds.
Returns
true on success or false on failure; call SDL_GetError() for more information.
Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
See also

2851 if (SDL_strncmp(name, "Nintendo ", 9) == 0 && SDL_strstr(name, " IMU") != NULL) {
2852 // Don't treat the Nintendo IMU as a separate gamepad
2853 return true;
2854 }
2855 if (SDL_endswith(name, " Accelerometer") ||
2856 SDL_endswith(name, " IR") ||
2857 SDL_endswith(name, " Motion Plus") ||
2858 SDL_endswith(name, " Nunchuk")) {
2859 // Don't treat the Wii extension controls as a separate gamepad
2860 return true;
2861 }
2862#endif
2863
2864 if (name && SDL_strcmp(name, "uinput-fpc") == 0) {
2865 // The Google Pixel fingerprint sensor reports itself as a joystick
2866 return true;
2867 }
2868
2869#ifdef SDL_PLATFORM_WIN32
2870 if (SDL_GetHintBoolean("SDL_GAMECONTROLLER_ALLOW_STEAM_VIRTUAL_GAMEPAD", false) &&
2871 SDL_GetHintBoolean("STEAM_COMPAT_PROTON", false)) {
2872 // We are launched by Steam and running under Proton
2873 // We can't tell whether this controller is a Steam Virtual Gamepad,
2874 // so assume that Proton is doing the appropriate filtering of controllers
2875 // and anything we see here is fine to use.
2876 return false;
2877 }
2878#endif // SDL_PLATFORM_WIN32
2879
2880 if (SDL_IsJoystickSteamVirtualGamepad(vendor_id, product_id, version)) {
2881 return !SDL_GetHintBoolean("SDL_GAMECONTROLLER_ALLOW_STEAM_VIRTUAL_GAMEPAD", false);
2882 }
2883
2884 if (SDL_allowed_gamepads.num_included_entries > 0) {
2885 if (SDL_VIDPIDInList(vendor_id, product_id, &SDL_allowed_gamepads)) {
2886 return false;
2887 }
2888 return true;
2889 } else {
2890 if (SDL_VIDPIDInList(vendor_id, product_id, &SDL_ignored_gamepads)) {
2891 return true;
2892 }
2893 return false;

◆ SDL_UpdateGamepads()

void SDL_UpdateGamepads ( void )

Manually pump gamepad updates if not using the loop.

This function is called automatically by the event loop if events are enabled. Under such circumstances, it will not be necessary to call this function.

Since
This function is available since SDL 3.2.0.
